reviews.review_msg: She's very energetic but everything goes too fast. Exams are not really hard

She is a nice prof, she tries hard to help student understand the material.  Keep in mind discrete math is not an easy material to grasp, so expect to spend loads of hours in the Algebra Workshop.  I did not learn anything during the lecture except copy loads of notes.  She writes notes on a Tablet but she refuses to put notes up online.
Nice prof, clear in-class notes and fantastic downloadable notes. The subject is pretty hard though, a lot of stuff crammed into one class.
i like it better when i go to her office hours, i understood the material better. she's so fast, sometimes i just can't keep up. but she seems to be happy teaching the course.

Dr. Mishna is very enthused about the material, and it shows. She does tend to go rather quickly, but is available for extra clarification if needed. The material in this class is not easy, and the pace is dictated by the its volume. My guess is most of the complaints come from people who are not used to difficult math classes. Exams were fair.

Very energetic like she took drugs just before class. She talks so fast that it's super hard to keep up. Hands cramp up after every class because of the intensive writing. She gives out bonus points for class participation, but what the hell's the point if she's only going to ask the 1 group that's sitting right in front of her all the time???

Talks way too fast and sometimes what she teaches is completely wrong.  Always gets corrected by the students.  She says the textbook sucks but then her notes are straight out of the book.  Midterms were difficult but the marks were scaled.  Tossed candy into some guy's face.

Must be drinking 4 cups of coffee before each lecture.  I can normally keep up with lecture but this woman is fast!    This also affects her ability to speak, as she randomly spurts different things.  You can't follow by listening to her lecture, you have to be there and attentively watch.  She made the course extremely difficult. Avg midterm: <45%
Enthusiastic, but writes way too fast. The course was hard and she seemed to teach to the top percentile of students.
VERY hard class! she tries her best to teach material but writes too much too fast. it's either write down or understand not both. midterm avg was close to/below 50%.
VERY had class! she tries her best to teach material but writes too much too fast. it's either write down or understand not both. midterm avg was close to/below 50%.
Difficult to keep up with her and copy down her notes at the same time.
No Comments

Very nice, very approachable prof, even if you aren't in his class. He takes time to explain in a very understandable manner; understandable why he's won national excellence in teaching awards before. His YouTube series are also extraordinarily helpful!

Jamie Mulholland is a splendid man with a 99th percentile ability in teaching mathematics. He subbed for my teacher when he went on strike for MACM201. Instantly, me and many others understood the material much better. Jamie is a systematic and peaceful lecturer. Thank you Jamie.
Jamie's MACM 201 lecture videos are A+ grade. They will save you from other profs who can't finish the material in 50min, or simply can't explain clearly.
I think pandemic got the best of him. Sub par. Doesnt care. Doesnt reply to my email.

Jamie was very organized & accessible outside of class. His lectures are great, clear examples & explanation. He doesn't waste any time. Most of what you need to know is in lecture and assignments. Discrete 2 is a difficult course, but Jamie is fair and there were no surprises. Effort will take you far in his class. Thank you Jamie!
Great professor, give Jamie some slack. Math is a hard subject to teach, but he is able to do it wonderfully. Would definitely take his classes again! :)
Midterms are doable (if you put in the work) but the timing of them is not. Not worth to take this class with this prof again even though he was rated almost a 5/5. Such a shame.
Engaging and clearly communicates. Thoroughly explains questions in an easy to understand manner. Here is award winning and I highly recommend him.

The lectures were dry and his midterms and finals were disproportionately harder than his homework or note examples. He understood the material but could not convey the information properly to the class. Would sometimes jump around in concepts which would make them unnecessarily harder than needed. Was available to help though.

Midterm averages around 40%. A large portion of the class failed. He did not scale, he's also not really on your side about marks. Although he's very clear with material, but issue's the course... materials tough, exams are rough.
The class averages were around 40 percent in terms of midterms. He didn't scale either so a good chunk of the class failed. It's a tough course and profs can only help with the simple concepts.

Quizzes, midterms, final all fair, no surprises. Do weekly assignments, redo in class examples. He goes fast in lectures and its a bit hard to follow. He'll time to time go over time limit. Sometimes skips over examples in lecture because no time but they'll still be testable. Good prof overall. MACM 201 is not as hard as people make it to be.
Finally a professor who actually wants you to do good in his class and CARES, very helpful, he is the best prof I ever taken! Oh and MACM 201 is a breeze compared to MACM 101.
His lectures are clear and easy to follow. This course is not as hard as people claim if you just do the assigned questions and make sure you follow the class materials in a timely fashion.

MACM 201 is a difficult course, but Karen's efforts made it easy. Out of every MATH or MACM class I've taken, her notes were the clearest and most detailed, and she clearly cared about (a) the grades we got; (b) our understanding of the material. Again, it's a hard course - do the homework, attend the lectures, and you'll do great.

Karen is a great prof, Macm 201 is not an easy course by any means. She expects a lot of you and expects you to put in effort. Midterms were difficult (mainly because of time constraint) and final was easier.
Exams were hard!

The only person to take MACM 201 with. Really cares about students and does her best to test fairly based on actual material covered. Midterms are really tough. This is notoriously one of the most difficult courses for comp sci majors, but Karen teaches the material in a very understandable and approachable way.

Notes are messy and difficult to understand; you need to print her skeleton notes out and fill them in during class. She goes too fast so you won't be able to take thorough notes without them. Concepts are not explained in a clear and straightforward way. You should use the textbook if you don't understand everything well.

This course wasn't as bad as I had expected. Karen goes through many examples in class. She is also very helpful outside of class and gives thorough explanations over email as well as the Canvas discussion board. The midterms were a bit hard (due to the time limit, not the actual questions), but the final was easy. I couldn't really ask for more.

For clarity, if you don't read class materials before her lecture, then there is a high chance that you won't understand a thing, as she goes through notes very fast, and expected you to know the basics. Her midterms are difficult, as you generally won't find enough time to finish them, but the final is quite easy. Overall, she's okay.

She explains a lot of the material and does a lot of examples too so you would understand the material. I also think she doesn't deserve the hate some of the people give her. The material is hard and she does say to work hard to do well. Although I wished she would write clearer and go over things slower, she is the prof to take MACM 201 with.

Karen Yeats is an amazing professor. MACM201 is a very tough course -- she makes the material to be tested a lot more reasonable as opposed to the other professors that teach this course. Aside from that, she's very proficient in her field and teaches extremely well. Wouldn't have taken this course with any other professor. Be ready to put in work.

Highly Underrated. I don't know why people rate easiness based on the course material. It's not supposed to be easy, this is tough math. She goes quick so you have to bring your A game, but will always help those who put in the effort and ask for it.
Just avoid her at any cost.
Good that notes were fill in printouts, however I feel the class was pretty rushed, content could get unclear and her writing is really messy. Will need the textbook, definitely a hard class.

I never saw a woman work that hard like her. She is pregnant, but she never miss one lecture even she is sick. This course is hard. You need to work hard and be clever. Her exams are very hard, but the final is better than the midterms.

Printing her notes and filling them out saved my grade; I didn't the first few weeks and those were the worst weeks. Review them and study her examples and especially the practice midterm(s) she puts up, they'll be the difference between a D and a B grade. She's also funny! Glad I took it with her (and LOVE her notes, cant stress it enough).

Go over the class too fast and very bad handwriting, hard to read. Mid-terms are tough, average below 50%. While she is very willing to help and really have passion to do math. Anyways, good person, smart good at math but not a good teacher for me. If you are not a math guy, probably choose another teacher for MACM201.

She speaks very fast and there is no time to Liston and understand and take notes. Her assignments includes proofs are not clear even when you get help from TA  they do not know the answer, her midterm and final are not fair and highly recommended avoid her.

She's a nice prof, very enthusiastic and has great notes but the material is often taught way too quickly. MACM201 is a brutal course but she manages to teach it a lot better than other profs I've heard of. If you print out her note outlines you can just keep up with her and they're great for studying later. I'd recommend taking it with her.

Very nice and helpful teacher. She is very engaging, likes to ask questions to students, and will keep repeating sth until everyone understands. The only drawback is that she teaches very fast and her writing is messy. I would recommend her though, and if you have questions you should go to her office hours.
her writing is messy and teaching so fast. MT's are ridiculously hard...I heat her, I need to repeat this subject again

I have had this prof twice for a sub. He came into my calc 2 class for a week and that was the worst week ever. He is now currently filling in for my MACM 201 class. Same feeling. I wish my original prof would come back. He is just not good a good teacher. I fear that for next week my grade will drop significantly due to him filling in for a week.

Lectures are hard to understand because they go by fast and his writing is messy. Our quizzes and midterms seemed to be either much harder, or graded much harder than the other sections this term. The average for the second midterm was below 50%. MACM201 is a brutal course regardless of the prof.

Yes, MACM 201 is very difficult. The averages for the midterms often aren't even a passing grade. Nevertheless, I don't think the difficulty is increased when taking it with Rattan, in-fact I think he's a pretty good prof, and his teaching style is quite informative and clear. Obviously if you can take the course With Jamie Mulholland, do it.

Rattan is a funny prof and a solid choice. He cares that you know the concepts. MACM 201 is a hard course. If you can't have Jamie, then choose this guy and also watch Jamie's videos when you're confused. Amp's a nice guy and doesn't deserve a harsh rep.

This prof should be the last option for MACM 201. This class is heavy on theory and lots of proofs. You need to understand and go over everything to at least do decent. Midterm averages very low and you spend 10+ hours on homework just for them to mark 2 questions where u can possibly get 4/8. Very unfair after all that work.
not a class u want to take with. Midterms r so bad and cant finish it.

People who gives Professor Rattan a 1 don't know what they are talking about. His teaching is not bad and he's not totally unreasonable. I have had other math profs who are both unreasonable and arrogant. Even if the prof can't teach, I will give them a 2. The only time I would give a prof a 1 is if they cant teach and is unreasonable themself.

Would only take Rattan if he was the only option. Better to take any other professor as Rattan's lectures are not very clear. The class average was also a C while other MACM 201 sections had way higher averages.

The midterm 3 was very hard, he said he would decide to adjust the mark but he didn't do it at the end. He explained not quit clear. I wouldn't say he is a bad prof, but if you want to have good grade, I think you should choose other profs.

The professor is very unclear to the stuff he himself deleiver. The most confuse person I've ever seen. Not co-operative and he is not gonna listen and try to understand your methods to solve the problems. He cares for his tchniques. TA's are strict in marking. Dont't go for him if you really wanna understand the concepts.

Prf Rattan is a good professor. My only two criticisms would be that sometimes he would struggle to find simple/clear explanation for certain topics, and sometimes he let us out of class a little late. Outside of that he was a very good professor in my opinion. Midterms and quizzes were very fair, midterm q's were usually modified q's from review.

Tests and quizzes bases heavily off of assignments and practice tests. Very caring prof, which is great outside of lecture. Will answer any and all questions during lecture, which leads to lectures being sidetracked fairly regularly with off topic discussions.

Not a useful instructor. It's better to rely on the TAs in workshop instead of the lectures. He is not willing to answer questions in lectures, which makes the thing devolve into a glorified Youtube video, and not a good one at that.

Nothing to say in particular. He is good, but my only complaint that his speaking style was putting me to sleep. I was really unengaged during lectures despite the fact that on some level I could see he is good. Make sure to pay attention tho and put in effort in this course cause for a lot of you this is a very new style of math
Chill instructor, boring at times. Other than that tests were pretty fair, this is just a tough course.
Good professor overall, no complaints, Macm201 is just a hard course.
Decent prof for MACM 201. Kinda boring, but delivery is pretty standard and tests are pretty fair I'd say
No Comments
No Comments
THE BEST!

Jamie really gets you hooked in to math. All of his lectures are accessible online on YouTube, and his explanations are in layman's terms. Exams are fair - most questions are a slight application of the problems you have solved in your assignments. Definitely recommend taking his class whenever you can.

Does a great job lecturing. He explains concepts very clearly and shows the methods to do problems very well. He obviously cares about the quality of his teaching and it shows. I removed a star as I felt the work load was somewhat unreasonable. The weekly homework assignments could take more than 6 hours but only 2 of the 15+ Qs would be marked.

I have never had a professor explain hard questions in such an easy to understand way. Really makes that light bulb go off in your head and suddenly the solution seem obvious. Great lectures and super helpful office hours. Exams were fair, the first one was tight on the time but he took that feedback and adjusted the length of the next ones.

Assignments are brutal and they only mark two questions in each (normal for all macm profs). That being said, Jamie is the best prof u can get for macm. SUPER good lectures and clear notes. Super accessible, friendly, and cares about his students. Can't recommend him enough.
Jamie is a real gem of a prof.

I usually don't review but after reading the blasphemy people are spewing about Jamie I had to step in. MACM 201 is a hard course and not everyone will do well. Jamie gives the lectures that are easy to understand and seems to genuinely care about students. Tests and homework are fair, but this is discrete math and not everyone will get an A+.

Dr Mulholland is a good lecturer but as others have mentioned the material in lecture and assignments don't translate to what's tested on the exam. He provides a review before every exam but even after working through all of those problems with relative ease the exam doesn't go well. Had him for math251 and it was totally different, macm is worse.

The bad reviews for MACM201 this semester are all just people who are bitter they can't keep up in the course. Jamie is a fine prof who provides decent lectures and helpful office hours. Did everyone do bad in MT1? Yes, but he scaled a lot. Math is supposed to be hard guys, having a low average is the norm. Stop acting like you're entitled to an A.

TAs took off bunch of marks for not justifying how I got my equation yet I clearly stated and showed diagrams. With the time limit there shouldnt be such harsh marking. This is on Jamie due to the questions and time limit he gives. Will never take a math class with him again. Cant believe he was rated so potentially high, nearly a 5/5.
average 52% on first midterm, slightly higher on the second midterm, highly feel the lack of consideration during these exams resulting in confusion and stress.

Midterms were much harder than expected. Especially due to the time limit I couldnt finish. The lectures he gives us is fine but doesnt correlate to the midterms in a way. Homework is very annoying to do as the TAs only mark 2 questions out of the 10+ so after putting in 10+ hours, you can get a 4/8 or 0/8 quite easily. Not a good prof.

Thee Jamie Mullholland failing to hold his standards. Unfair exams , notes that dont connect to what is being tested, not considering how difficult it is to meet the time limit set, and before anyone says anything otherwise, ask yourself, why was the first midterm average a 52 with a C- being 36%. Happy I got in his class but now disappointed.

Midterm 1, ran out of time where a student had to address this issue to the prof himself. Prof said theyll consider the timing and the questions moving forward. Midterm 2, ran out of time again with more students from midterm 1. Where was there consideration? Fair exams is what I heard of Jamie in university but for MACM 201 its a big lie.

Midterm 1 and 2 are done, now I can conclude that Jamie doesnt make this class any more enjoyable. His lectures are taught well but the midterms arent even related to it. He said that doing the review and going over lecture notes should be enough, I did that with ease and absolutely bombed midterm 2. Not sure why but his exams are not fair.
Take him if you wanted to enjoy the course. Clear lectures and exams are reasonable. Revise quizes and any previous midterms for finals.

I received a low grade in this class (my fault), but I still believe that Jamie is the best math instructor at SFU. His lectures, notes, assignments, grading criteria and exams are all extremely clear. His exams were also fair and we weren't graded on a curve. This made students more inclined to help each other. We had an awesome discord group too!
Lectures were great and exams were fair. Top tier math prof.
I would take any course he teaches, Jamie is an absolute legend. The best in the west hands down.
Engaging and clearly communicates. Thoroughly explains questions in an easy to understand manner. Here is award winning and I highly recommend him.

Cedric gets a bad rap on here - maybe it's from previous years teaching, I don't know.  He's not bad at all - MACM 201 is a rough course, and yeah, the guy has at least one typo or error per slide, but if you do the homework questions and properly review, you'll find the assessments are relatively simple. I know people that got a C- with 45%.
Excellent lecturer. Fair marking scheme, but he will make you work for your grade.

You will get used to his accent! He is ORGANIZED; i.e. you should read in advance, finish assignments before quizzes, and read summary notes every week.  He is CONSISTENT; He will tell you what will be on the exam, and you should be on top of every subject that he tests.  He is generous in grading.  Also, It's an 'n' not an 'm' (you'll see).
the worst professor i've ever seen. he doesn't know the hell he's talking about. wouldn't recommend to anybody

Chauve has a bit of an accent and his writing takes a while to get used to but his lectures are fairly decent. Tests are difficult but he will tell you exactly what kind of questions there are and if he doesn't you can ask him to in his review classes and then practice those kinds of questions out of the textbook and you'll be fine.

Cedric helped make a difficult subject somewhat clear. The homework questions he created taught me more than many of the questions from the textbook.   His exams are difficult but his lectures give you an idea of what kind of questions he's going to ask. No big surprises here.  Understand the lecture notes and do all of the homework questions!

His accent and handwriting make lectures quite a bit more difficult.  The textbook doesn't help all the time because he occasionally uses methods not in the book and expects STRICTLY those methods for quizzes and exams. The quizzes and hwk are much easier than the exams, making it hard to gauge exam difficulty and to practice for.

Bad teaching techniques mixed with a strong french accent. You will need to put forward a substantial effort if you are looking to get a good mark with him as your'e teacher. Of course if you can speak french you may do better...

The course is pretty difficult.  You will have to pre-read the text, attend lecture, and review after.  His additional question for weekly homework is pretty much impossible.  However, the exams are fare and pretty easy if you practice the essental material. The exams are clear and the questions are straight forward.

One of the harder courses you'll come by in CS lower level courses. I recommend avoid taking his class if you can, unless you have strong grasp of MACM 101. His overhead notes are difficult to read + his accent doesn't help. The textbook for this course are one of the worst I've seen too. Very frustrating. Visit Macm workshop frequently!

You'll need to do quite a lot of practice on your own for this course (few hours a week), so it'll really burn you if you're lazy.  Textbook isn't all that useful especially without a solution manual.
he's pretty good at 'controlling' the class average at around 50%(usually 40%- for midterms). So its your call if or not take his class.
good teacher, very interesting assignments, challenging questions. great course.

Matthew is definitely one of the best math profs at SFU. His passion in his lectures is great and it really keeps you engaged. The assessments were very straight forward and reasonable. This class is definitely very tough but with him, it was a breeze. He's super approachable and his teaching style is awesome, would recommend 10000%.

Matthew is very passionate about MACM and it shows, he also cares about his students. I did find his lectures slightly scattered (would jump between points while explaining) or rushed sometimes, which didn't match my learning style great (obviously might be different for you). BUT he is very engaging and the quizzes and exams were fair. Great prof!
He knows the content very well, but has difficulty explaining it. Very kind and considerate, but not great at teaching. Save yourself some time and watch Jamie Mulholland's video series instead.

Dr. Devos is a great proff! He is very caring and takes the time to actually listen to your concerns. Just talk to the guy and you will feel more confident in the subject. His lectures are quick and the pace of the class is quite demanding but it is to be expected from a MACM class. Makes MACM a bit let threatening so he deserves a 5/5.

Knows well and explains well, although can be absent-minded sometimes. Homework every week to be tested in quizzes, the usual LD math setup. Exams are fair and reasonable in length. Does not expect you to have crazy deep knowledge of theorems at this level. I recommend him for any math class.

Matt is a good prof, explains the concept clearly. He releases a big review package that resembles the actual exam before midterms and finals, which is really helpful. The only con is he gets distracted easily during lectures and often can't finish the material in time.

I like him but I hate his lecture. One of the worst prof at explaining things, especially for such an abstract subject. The course material itself is kinda hard already and his lecture definitely makes life harder... But he always scales the grade based on overall performance of you and the class, so if you work hard you can still get decent grade.

Tends to make his tests too difficult/long. Before a midterm, he said that it would be straightforward, but then afterward he said that on second thought it was too technical. Class average was a C+. His lectures were clear enough and he keeps his word (kept a quiz cancelled even when a transit strike gets cancelled, and he curves the tests).

This guy's the best math professor I've ever had. He made such an intense, theory heavy course look doable. Clears doubts in a class of 450! Really good at explaining concepts. Gave a 5% curve on both midterms. The quizzes were 9/10 at least, if you do the homework problems. This guy is real passionate for the subject.

Well-organized notes. Great oral speaker. Occasionally rushes through some examples because of time constraints but his office hour explanations were absolutely fantastic. I learned a lot from him that I otherwise would not have with another prof. Superb knowledge and communicative skills. He's also very understanding when it comes to exams.

Made a notoriously hard course easier than I expected. Exam questions were just slight variations of the quiz / homework questions for the most part. He skipped over some of the less important / hard parts which was nice (2nd part of GFs, probability, etc). Kinda frazzled during lectures but still explains stuff clearly.

Probably the best prof for MACM 201. Matt did a good job making a hard course a little easier. Some lectures were poorly paced and he would lose track of time but overall they were good. Did extremely helpful review sessions before the midterms and final. Curved the midterm scores (i.e for the first midterm 22/30 was an A)

Rarely prepared for lectures. Notes are not uploaded in a timely manner. If you find him outside of class time, he will stay hours to explain any topics you want. Midterms are what is covered in lectures and quizzes. Only the final exam required thinking outside the box.

This professor is simply a beauty. Has decent explanations of concepts and makes a hard course more straightforward. Quiz and exam questions are just a variation of the non-graded homework. He sometimes was slow to upload notes to Canvas; one note package was uploaded the morning of the final. However, the workshop can clarify concepts very well.
No curve in the class. Lecture is very slow and he sometime forgot to upload the note. The last lecture note was upload on the morning of the final day. Not suggesting him.

Awesome lecturer for MACM 201. Perfectly explained what was going to be on each midterm and final. Went a little slow in some lectures and forced us to learn material on our own sometimes (due to him running out of time). Otherwise awesome guy with a great teaching style.

He explains concepts very well, although he re-explains the same concepts multiple times before he moves on so he often runs out of time. Exams are as fair as they can get. Devos makes a GPA killer course into a GPA booster.

Fantastic prof for MACM201. He knows theres A LOT of material to go over and doesnt try to make trick questions to stump you. He puts fair questions that are based on the assignments and it shows in how well the class does. Thank you Matt!

Good lectures, but slow, the guy's a bit nervous. Very fair exams, similar conceptually to homework, as well as in terms of difficulty. What you're expected to know and do is very clearly outlined. Cares alot about student concerns. Took a notoriously difficult course and made it easier, which to some can be taken as a bad thing. Not for me though.
Good lecturer, makes a boring course bearable. Lots of energy and explains concepts well.
He is a good prof and his exams are easier than usual. He gives a limited amount of maths for practice and all the exam question comes in that pattern. HE IS NOT ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS.

Leverages lecture and homework material for exams, sometimes even the same questions with slight additions and twists. Is very knowledgeable about the course, but tends to proceed at a snails pace in some lectures. Is not the best at keeping up with posting course material with any sort of punctuality but still gets the job done eventually.

He is an very good prof, Exams and quizzes are fair. As long as you show up for every class and make sure you study the assignments you will do well on the quizzes and exam. I've heard a lot of people saying MACM201 is going to hard but he is very good at explaining the concepts

First time I've left a review - Dr. DeVos knows his stuff well. While he occasionally stumbles with his words in lecture it's only because the material is so deep and so interesting for him that he can't help it, plus the fact that the class sizes are huge. You definitely need to read the textbook and do all homework problems to get a good grade.
Very passionate professor and makes a harsh course very very interesting and easier gets his questions from the quizzes, take it with him if you can

The other reviews are right. If you don't have a choice and have to take this course with him,practice every single week and go to office hours as much as possible. Not even close to the worst prof or course I've had, but it takes more work than it should. There are plenty of resources available online as well. Don't fall behind and you're gucci.

His self written "textbook" is horrible. His lectures are dense and hard to understand. His tests are the worst. Low class average. Too many questions packed into the 50 min limit. I think he's close to retirement age I don't think he cares anymore or maybe he never did.

Professor Abraham's method for math seems ineffective. Cancelling office hours before midterms,and suggesting emails for help, are impractical for math problems. The midterm, with 20 multiple-choice and 4 long-answer questions, didn't account for solving time An assignment is due post-midterm including exam topics.I'd recommend avoiding his classes

The first thing he tells you is not to listen to this website and that he is a "good teacher". DO NOT LISTEN and TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR. His notes alone deserve a 1 star rating. He had a quiet, challenging, passive personality that does not work with teaching a hard course. He withholds information and doesn't reveal solutions to homework.
Great instructor. Amazing notes and super clear course materials through Canvas.

Charles is the most thorough and caring instructor Ive ever had. Beyond having incredibly informative and helpful lectures, he was very passionate about making sure students understood the material and didnt leave a student until they understood a question completely, approaching it in loads of different ways. Also very accessible outside of class
Tests are fair and the lecture notes he posted online were very useful. He also does a review session before each midterm/final where the important stuff to know is mentioned. Would highly recommend.

Turo is great! He explains concepts very well, works through examples for every topic, and takes questions throughout. He makes the homework/tests/lectures consistent, works through problems in the lab with students 2 hours a week, and posts notes and worked out feedback for tests online. He wants you to succeed. Would recommend for sure!

Although the contents of this course are not quite easy for studying and understanding, charles makes the lecture very clear and organized, feel free to ask questions during the lecture. Exams are fair, if u do the assigned questions in your weekly assignemnt, you will find the questions in the exam are really straightforward. Recommand him.
No Comments
A little quiet but is in general quite good. The homework was easy
questions on the exam were not related to the text
No Comments
Best prof during the online class, the course is really organized, weekly assignment (hard but definitely learn something), midterms are easier than the assignments
Fair assignments and exams that you can do well on if you study the material.

This was not an easy course. I often felt that the assignment questions were unrelated to what we learned in lectures, and felt lost simply going off of lecture content alone (YouTube helps). However, the exams were all quite reasonable and contained questions almost word for word out of the assignments. Trev Tutor (YouTube) is your friend.

Mr. Monagan is probably the best prof I've ever had at the university level. There are no surprises when taking his courses. He takes a tough course and makes it very understandable and even interesting. Midterm and Final are based on assignments so no real surprises. If you ever get to take him always pick him, legit best prof I've had.

I wish all the professors at SFU are as wholesome as him. I'm not sure what else can I ask for: he's organized, midterms are easy and straight out of assignments, he's good at explaining... There are so many things about him that I appreciate. Final exam was difficult for me since I didn't study much but 11/10 I recommend this professor.

Provides high quality, straightforward lectures. He is clear at explaining concepts and identifying which are of higher priority than others, and gives very thoughtful and in-depth explanations when questioned. He is not afraid to give of his own time to enhance the lecture. If he is available for 201, jump on it - makes a difficult class easy.

Michael Monagan is an amazing professor. I took MACM101 with Binay and I found it exponentially harder than this course. Monagan has extremely clear lectures and doing his homework and assignments is very rewarding because the exams are super fair and related to the assignments. He answers all the questions students have clearly. Best professor.

As far as class structure goes, this is easily one of the best. First off you get extremely clear lectures from Dr. Monagan. Every 1-2 weeks you have an assignment on these lectures which gives you quick feedback. After every two assignments, you get a midterm. If you attend lectures and do the assignments, you will succeed in this course.
Dr. Monagan is so organized and it really helps you never get lost. his lectures are interesting and exams and assignments are pretty reasonable
Alright teacher.  But the TAs that mark the tests are tough markers.
Good prof, tough marker.
taught very well, but his TA marked the exam terribly. One small mistake would cost you more than half sometimes.
Nice, clear prof, but the material is very difficult (I don't think the instructor can do much in this case).
well~ he's a good prof but the course itself is sooo hard!!!!
This class is hard.
Lee = textbook..... he just said what the textbook said. well, why need the teacher....and yes.. i was in it when half the class failed his course in the summer
lol! Half of the class failed last semester. He hires horrible TAs. That means you'll never get a good grade in his class.
Good prof. Very no-nonsense...doesn't really try to connect with students, but his lectures are informative and he gives good examples. The course material itself is very difficult.
He's a really helpful prof, however the course itself is very hard, so u better study alot before the exam.
Good teaching with plenty of examples and fair exams.  However the course is challenging so study hard!

Great teacher.  He has a bit of an accent, but nothing too bad.  His tests are straight from the homework he assigns.  In class, he gives tons of examples so the assignments are fairly easy.  His marking scale is kind of tough(5 A's out of 75 students)
straight-forward, clear, organized, excellent notes, exam difficulty level generally matches homework and textbook, nothing tricky.

Took it with him and from talking to people who have taken this course with other profs, it seems he makes it quite a bit easier. So if you want an easier time, just take it with him. I'm not amazing at math, and found the mid terms pretty straight forward. Also he's a good teacher and has a good pace. Doesn't rush through material.

Incredible prof. Made MACM accessible to everyone. Have never learned as much from another class; he didn't just teach the concepts but also took days to talk about how they have real world applications. Fair exams.

One of the greatest prof I've met in this university. Very attracting and well-prepared lecture makes content easy to understand. The difficulty for the quizzes and exams are medium. Also, he is pretty responsible that he shows up for every of his office hour and extend office hour if there's exams. I will definitely take course again with him.
Very friendly person. The course materials were difficult, but his exam questions were easier than practice questions in the textbook. As long as you solve all homework problems, you can't fail.

Iain is the best math professor I've ever had. He's friendly, funny & seems genuinely interested in the subject. His lectures are clear & well structured, he assigns weekly homework assignments that are very helpful in learning & mastering the material. Quizzes/exams are fair & expectations are clearly communicated, & similar to exam content.
Lectures were very enjoyable. Midterms and final were very fair.
quizzes and exams were fair and his a funny guy.

unlike most profs at university, Iain Cramp, has cut-offs for midterms about, a week before the exam, that means material, a few days before the exam isn't tested. This gives you time to not bomb the exams. For Finals, his cutoff, was 2 weeks before the final!!, Incredible!
Great teacher, very fair, always willing to help and explains things clearly. It was still one of the hardest courses I've taken in a while, but he still made it enjoyable.

Unnervingly charming considering he is a STEM graduate student.   Clear and confident voice. He knows his stuff and has no trouble getting it across to you. Exams are very fair. He gives us hints on what he will examine us on and the questions aren't too tricky.    Would DEFINITELY take a class with him again.

The materials for this course are exactly the same as Jamie's videos. Nils's quizzes and exams are very fair. Since homework questions are not submitted but instead used for quizzes, it does mean that all assessments are timed tests. Practice your homework questions and in-class examples, and you'll be fine for exams.
just don't sit in the first few rows, his breath is awful

Dr. Nils Bruin is a pretty good prof. His 1.8 rating is certainly undeserved. His lectures can be hard to follow, but I feel that it could just be a byproduct of the content rather than his lecturing abilities to some extent. His writing can be hard to read but you do get used to it. His tests are pretty damn fair too.

Nils isn't a bad nor a great prof, the general lecture material was exactly the same as Jamie's videos (example problems were identical). Quizzes were easy and pulled from the weekly HW with a few numerical changes. Midterms and Final were harder but fine, do ALL the HW (go to office hours if you need help) + the review packages and you'll be fine

Makes little calculation errors while teaching and has to correct himself often but I respect the enthusiasm and passion he has for mathematics. You will learn a lot. The exams were fair. The quizzes were quite straightforward since they were completely based on the assignments every week (which you don't even need to submit)
Gave pretty fair hws and exams, hand writing was a little hard to read, not a complete deal breaker tho. You have the support of Jaimie's videos so lecture isn't rlly mandatory

nils bruin is a literal stutter machine. his exams are tough and his voice is extremely hard to decipher. avoid this prof if you can, if you can't just suck it up and study day and night and maybe you will pass.

Nils seems passionate about MACM201, which is always appreciated. He can be overly semantic and hard to follow, his handwriting is hard to read, and his notes aren't very well organized. He would also often make simple arithmetic mistakes. I felt the quizzes and exams did fairly cover the material in the course though, without being too difficult.

I had math151 &math 150 with dear Nils. Unfortunately, I have to take macm201 with him again. Just try to avoid him as your best. He is not good at teaching, so basically you have to self-study. Also if the previous exam grades are high, he is gonna offer you a tricky final. He destroyed my math151 by this way. Anyways, try to get rid of him!

Tom is extremely nice and helpful, he really tries to give the studies an advantage for the tests and assignments. The course is very difficult regardless of the prof, even though it was Tom's first teaching job I thought he did alright. Make sure you read the sections before class and go ask questions during office hours!
Very helpful prof. Goes into a lot of details. He even posts the lecture notes online.
He's a horrible professor. He just fumbles through the lecture. It almost seems like he's improvising.

His lectures are very unclear and even incomplete. He wastes too much time mumbling during explanation. Almost one third of materials are not covered, and they are still asked in tests. Class average for midterm 2 was 54%, but still no curving. He said it is his first time teaching, and I guess it will become his last time as well.
God awful at teaching. I almost felt like crying in his class.

Prof regularly makes mistakes when teaching, and is very hard to understand. He told us 1/3 of the midterm would be from the practice problems, and easier than any previous midterm. The class average is pretty much a fail, and he only took one question from the practice problems. I knew all the concepts going into the exam, and was clueless

He's incredibly nice. But, he cannot teach at all. His lectures are unclear as are his notes. He makes a ton of mistakes while teaching. I come out of lectures knowing less than I did when going in. He says that the quizzes will be fair but are usually extremely hard. Same with exams
Prof is okay it's just that this course is very hard.

Pros: His midterms and finals are mostly very easy, He is a very generous marker and re-marker, entertaining in lecture, gives engaging assignments, posts notes online(huge help). Cons: Highly disorganized, makes tons of mistakes in lecture, late at posting assignments, quiz questions take way too long!!
lectures are organized. You should read textbook by yourself. Do the assignments, you will be fine on the quiz. midterm and final are not difficult. Overall, it's good prof

Luis is a very easy instructor. His explanations are clear and he tells you exactly what to expect for his midtermsexams. There are no tricks. Those who do the practice problems and optional problems will do well in the course. The people who complain about Luis are the people who didn't do the homeworkreadings or study.

I started out the course thinking it would be sufficient to do the assigned problems and a little extra reading.  Not a chance - his lectures and assignments focus on deeper understanding, but he doesn't provide a solid base to get there.  Especially in the first few weeks, do ALL the questions from the assigned chapters.  Overall, he's okay.

He is very enthusiastic, he made math interesting. Made some mistakes when solving problems which was little confusing. He will take the time to help you. The testing style in this course was very difficult, challenging problems and about a minute per question. If you are not good at math, expect to put a ton of work for an ok grade.

Luis is enthusiastic and pretty good at explaining concepts. He makes a few mistakes in lecture, but it really doesn't matter if you read the book. Assignments can be challenging, but the midterms are very fair. The final exam was much easier than any of the midterms as well. Would highly recommend Luis.

Pros: He posts all his lecture notes online. His exams are all very easy. He's very generous in marking. He is usually willing to help.  Cons: Very disorganized. Makes several mistakes in lecture. Often late to lecture and office hours. Usually takes too long to upload assignments.  Sometimes asks unreasonably long questions on the quizzes.

Luis doesn't go out of his way to make this course very difficult. He is a graph theorist though, so he likes to ask interestingdifficult questions about that kind of stuff. So I'd really put in a lot of work for those sections.

Luis isn't clear in lecture and isn't very helpful in the workshop. He makes a ton of mistakes on assignments, lectures and quizzes. With that being said, he is an extremely easy professor. Midterms are a cakewalk. Definitely recommend for compsci kids who only want a good grade.

Midterm was easy if enough time. It's not for  testing  your understanding but your memorizing & speed test. I hate the subject but understand it well by studying the book, however on midterm forgot the formula by the time i drive the formula,  time was up. Hate his exam style!

This is the second course I've taken with Luis and he has been the single worst prof I've had at SFU. His lectures are full of mistakes. He doesn't teach anything, just does examples in front of you. The textbook is ordered differently than how the concepts are taught in class so it's miserable trying to understand what to study. Avoid him.

Worst prof I've ever met at SFU. Do not hope to understand anything from his lectures, cause otherwise you will be very disappointed. Textbook is practically useless as well, as it's impossible to understand a single thing from it. So technically you're on your own: you pay tuition for this course, but you have to learn everything all by yourself
Terribly unorganized meaning lectures are borderline useless. Unfortunately, the required textbook is dreadful so you'll really use to work to do well.
Finally at SFU, we were tested on something we were taught, good job. Other profs should learn from this golden rule.

Exams are hard, way too much material. Requires a LOT of time. Great prof though, exams are based on what he teaches but there are just way too many things to understand. Not a course for those who are used to memorizing things. Average on the final exam was around 45%.
Great Prof. High energy. Midterms were reasonable, final was a bit more difficult but he helped a lot prior to the exam if you went to his office hours. Class is scaled. Managed to get an A+

It's almost compulsory to attend his class and take notes to do well in this course. His notes should be enough to understand easy topics, but reading the book is strongly recommended for hard sections like G.F. and Hamilton stuff. I managed to get A-; however, I'd say this course is on hard side. Not as hard as MATH232 but still expects much work.

He's a proff with a very engaging teaching style, so it's great to attend his lectures.  I expected a class with reasonable difficulty when I signed up. The first midterm was what I expected - very fair, good average grade. Second midterm however, was tougher and short on time. The final was difficult with unique questions. Class average was
Bad lectures for MACM 201 and hard and unexpected exams.
Extremely unreasonable midterms and exams. You only have enough time to do 25% of the questions. He expects you to memorize absolutely EVERYTHING.
Honestly a pretty good lecturer, but doesn't compare to the available online videos. Very fair midterms, very similar to the practice problems he provides.
Chutiya number one

There seems to be a vocal minority of students that are saying Bojan's exams are too hard and unfair. I found it to be the opposite. His exams were quite fair considering the course material, and quizzes were free marks if you understood the homework. His lectures are dry and not very helpful, so learn from the textbook.

Considering the horror stories I've heard of past profs, Dr. Mohar covered the material appropriately and with good illustrations / examples. At times VERY concise, expect to do a LOT of extra homework to keep up. It's worth trying weekly HW EARLY so that you get more out of lecture. Thanks to Dr. Mojar, I can now count, sometimes, kind of.

This prof does not seem to care about teaching anymore. He will often spend 10 minutes looking for a minor mistake in his examples he has done then skip steps to make up time. The quizzes are often different from the homework and the practice exams are much easier than the actual exam questions. Try to avoid this prof if you can.

Since the course itself is hard, you have to put some efforts on it. His lectures are pretty easy, but quizzes and midterms are challenging(if you did homework you are fine). Be aware of heavy course load.

Lectures could be hard to follow at times but if you spend some time studying and even do some pre-reading it was good. Exams and some quizzes were a bit more difficult than expected, but it isn't an easy course to begin with. Marking was very fair. I think he did a good job given the difficulty of this course and the massive size of the class.

He's a fine prof, much better than RMP would lead you to believe. Maybe not the best prof at SFU but a solid choice. Exams and quizzes are quite fair given the difficulty of this course. Course will be scaled, so as long as you do well compared to the average you will succeed. He posts lecture notes so you don't have to attend all lectures.
This instructor has nothing helpful, we paid more than 2000 dollars for this course but eventually we get nothing

Another absolutely terrible SFU prof (too many). When teaching he seems perpetually confused and skips steps that are more difficult leaving you guessing (not to mention mistakes in notes/lecture). Quizzes/Midterms are either too time consuming or too difficult to finish. Expect to take MACM 201 again if you take it with him as most people fail.

Bojan is the worst prof I've ever had. It is easy to see that he is tired of teaching and doesn't care about students' success. The worst thing is: his midterms are not related to homework and lectures. He gives misleading easy sample midterms to prep but then the actual test will be unrelated to anything seen before. Avoid this prof.

Ok let me clear something here, maybe Bojan is a good mathematician, but he is not good at teaching at all. Lectures are super easy, homework is doable, but exam and quiz do not make any sense. Avoid him with all the cost, it is ok to bear one semester with other courses, but no with this guy. Definitely need to learn how to teach.

This prof is by far the worst prof I have ever had. He doesn't even know the material himself, he skips all the difficult steps and just writes an answer on the lecture notes. Then he expects you to know how to solve it.

The content he goes over in the lectures is only tangentially related to the homework/quizzes/exams. Basically, he teaches you how to boil water in lecture and then expects you to cook up a five-star meal in his tests. Nice guy, and clearly very knowledgable about the content of the course, but just so inept at actually teaching it. Stay away.

Lectures are hard to follow confusing everyone in my group at the point he tries to get across. His examples are often just proofs that do not help for homework or exams. His first midterm was brutal most of the questions were unlike anything we had done before in homework with almost everyone I talked to expecting to fail and leaving pages blank.

First Midterm made no sense. Couldn't figure out how to put word problems into mathematical notation. Soooo much studying is needed. Always learning something new each lecture, exams involve more than memorization. It involves being able to apply correct formulas and algebraic expressions to answer complex sequences and lots of math theory.
Be prepared to transcribe very lengthy, typed slides at high speed each lecture, or you'll miss something.

generally nice guy. exams are alright. however very harsh on giving out grades. A great portion of students failed(including me). lectures are extremely boring. Do not take his class unless you are a math person. he would spend whole lectures just proving theorems and then expect u to reproduce those long proofs on exam. very painful course!

The professor is very lively and interesting in his lectures. He is good at giving examples to explain his views and the difficulty of the exam is moderate. If you have any questions about the content of learning, go directly to him, and he will answer your questions enthusiastically

Professor Liu is one of the best professors I have even seen at SFU. His lectures are very funny. For each concept, he gave various examples and sample questions with a solution to help you understand the concept as soon as possible. Even though you did not get the idea at the class, you can meet him after the class. He is very willing to help.

He was ok, assignments and quiz were fair. Making the course doable. Midterm one easy, midterm two a bit difficult, but final was very fair. Cares for students when he was trying to give effort marks if you attempted the problem but the higher-up guy didnt approve that, so no more. Boring lecture but easy pass.

It was his first time teaching so he was nervous in the beginning but when he got used to teaching he was amazing. Best memory is after MT2 when he completely destroyed someone complaining about the midterm "Hey man, if you fail just go into rapping" as the guy was talking way too fast

I hated macm101 and that prof. But honest to God, Pengyu honestly made macm201 100% doable and bearable. He legit tells you whats on final and its so FAIR! Proof: 65% is the Avg! Why? Because he actually CARES for the students. After class I recommend talking to this guy because hes honestly the nicest and chillest prof.
One of the best professors for a discrete math course in SFU. A very genuine person who is always willing to help.

I agree with 2 previous comments. The course is already hard he makes it even harder. I can see that he is trying to help us, but he lacks experience in being an instructor. Most of the time he gets confused with the notes because its some other instructors notes.
Definitely was not a good experience taking this class with him. I have to agree with the previous review, he indeed made this class unbearable.

He thinks that all the students taking this course has nothing else to do in life. He gives so much homework that if you try finishing it, you will not have enough for other classes. Already this course is the most hated courses at SFU, and He makes it unbearable. Why all math professors have to make student's life hell?
Best prof ever for macm 201. He can make you love the material! Fair in testing and reasonable for extra help.
a great prof
Best of all proffesor in Macm 201 cleary know what he is doing never bore you in class .helpful ........take his class if you get chance he is best
Great prof! Funny in lecture.Let people participate in questions in class. Test is combined with easy, medium, and trick questions. Can make you love MACM!

He explains everything clearly with many examples; extremely helpful and always prompt in responding to emails. This course includes various topics and it is a bit overloaded, as a result, you will find Jason often rushed to cover all the materials. Midterms and Final: 40% easy questions 40% medium level questions and 20% relatively hard.

Jason is a very likeable professor. He was able to teach a terrible course like MACM fairly well. Just make sure to show up for every class as he puts no notes online as they are all hand written in class.
The BEST math prof!
quiz and final are well related,both are fair enough,best math pro in SFU.
He is the best prof I have ever met in SFU. Everything you need to do is just read the note and attend the class on time.

Jungic is just about the best prof around. He may have an accent, but he's one of the few profs around who still gives a crap about his students. He once pulled over to drive my friend up the hill to SFU because my friend was late & it was raining. He's always helping out in the assignment labs and he will sit there til u get it. Whatta guy.
Excellent teacher.  He is really good at explaining, helps out students on his own time and interacts very well with students.

Without a doubt, I can say that Dr. Jungic is one of the best professors I've ever had at SFU. He is passionate about what he teaches and takes the time to explain things. I would recommend taking any course taught by him.
Cheezy (pretends to be stupid) but effective teaching style. Thick Russian accent does not hinder teaching ability.
No Comments
well-organized and fair. recommended.

If u do the additional questions given on the assignment sheet; its a guaranteed A. Everyone told me Macm 201 is very hard. but with Stephen Choi; its a piece of cake; just go to class; he makes things simpler; some mistakes during the lecture but over all; he's really helpful and easy
Not the prof u want if u want to learn math.
